channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Court backs Trump's control of National Guard. And, the latest on the Israel-Iran war
item.description: Trump can maintain control over California's National Guard troops in LA after a federal appeals court ruling. And, the president says he'll decide wh...

item.title: European officials hold talks with Iran in Geneva, seeking a diplomatic solution
item.description: It marks the most significant known diplomatic talks between Tehran and Western governments since Israel launched a surprise offensive against Iran on...

item.title: Why is caregiving so hard in America? The answers emerge in a new film
item.description: A new documentary on PBS shows what it's like to care for adult family members and recounts the history of caregiving policy in the U.S., revealing wh...

item.title: What children in poverty could lose from the 'Big Beautiful Bill'
item.description: Republicans want to change or reduce key social safety net programs that provide healthcare, food benefits and financial assistance for millions of ch...

item.title: A former DOGE employee gives his account of working for the operation
item.description: What did the Department of Government Efficiency actually accomplish under Elon Musk? And what might change now that Musk is out? One former DOGE work...

item.title: Zambian ex-president to be buried in South Africa after funeral row
item.description: Edgar Lungu's family has been engaged in a bitter dispute with the government over his funeral plans.

item.title: Trump administration to shutter specialized LGBTQ+ suicide lifeline option
item.description: A part of the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline dedicated to LGBTQ+ youth — known as 988 option 3 — will close in July, the agency said.

item.title: Israeli military kills 23 Palestinians near aid site in Gaza, witnesses and medics say
item.description: The Hamas-run health ministry says more than 400 Palestinians have been killed in this way since late May.

item.title: BBC shelves Gaza doc over impartiality concerns
item.description: Gaza: Doctors Under Attack, which was due to air in February, was made by an independent company.

item.title: Lukas Nelson starts a new chapter with "American Romance"
item.description: Grammy-winning singer-songwriter Lukas Nelson releases his solo album "American Romance" and opens up to Anthony Mason about the personal journey that...

item.title: US basketball training for Senegal cancelled after visas rejected
item.description: Players will train in Dakar instead "in a sovereign and conducive setting", says the prime minister.

item.title: Iranian foreign minister expected to hold talks with European officials in Geneva
item.description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi is set to meet with European officials from France, Germany and the United Kingdom in Geneva over escalating t...

item.title: $200,000 home equity loan vs. $200,000 HELOC: Which is less expensive now?
item.description: Before borrowing this much home equity, owners should compare the potential repayment costs of both products.

item.title: Niger military leaders to nationalise uranium firm
item.description: The company is majority French-owned, while the junta wants more local control of Niger's mineral wealth.

item.title: Aflac says hackers may have stolen costumers' personal information
item.description: The insurer said it stopped the intrusion after identifying suspicious activity on its U.S. network last week.

item.title: Photos of Juneteenth celebrations commemorating end to slavery
